edu.rit.util

Interface GraphSpec

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.Iterator<GraphSpec.Edge>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RandomGraph

    public interface GraphSpec
extends java.util.Iterator<GraphSpec.Edge>
    Interface GraphSpec specifies the interface for an object that specifies a graph. To obtain the specifications for a graph:

    1. Call the V() method to obtain the number of vertices.

    2. Call the E() method to obtain the number of edges.

    3. Repeatedly call the hasNext() and next() methods to obtain the edges themselves.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  GraphSpec.Edge
      Class GraphSpec.Edge encapsulates one edge in a graph.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.Iterator

        remove

    • Method Detail

      • V

        int V()
        Get the number of vertices in this graph specification.
        Returns:
        Number of vertices.

      • E

        int E()
        Get the number of edges in this graph specification.
        Returns:
        Number of edges.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Reset this graph specification. This restarts the iteration over the edges, such that calling hasNext() and next() will generate a fresh graph with the same number of vertices V and the same number of edges E.

      • hasNext

        boolean hasNext()
        Determine if there are more edges.
        Specified by:
        hasNext in interface java.util.Iterator<GraphSpec.Edge>
        Returns:
        True if there are more edges, false if not.

      • next

        GraphSpec.Edge next()
        Get the next edge.

        Note: The next() method is permitted to return the same Edge object, with different vertices, on every call. Extract the vertices from the returned edge object and store them in another data structure; do not store a reference to the returned edge object itself.

        Specified by:
        next in interface java.util.Iterator<GraphSpec.Edge>
        Returns:
        Next edge.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if there are no more edges.
